DoaEngine 3.0 API Documentation

This is the DoaEngine game framework documentation overview.

DoaEngine is a project that is intended to assist writing games in 2D space using the Java programming language.
It is build upon the Sun Microsystem's Graphics Context, which is then refactored to "AWT Graphics".

AWT (the Abstract Window Toolkit) is the predecessor of the renowned Swing Graphics. For more information on this: Swing Graphics.

Follow the project on GitHub.

Send a mail to the developer. (aeris170@gmail.com)

Packages
Package
Description
doa.engine
Mostly useless; things that don't fall into a package category.
doa.engine.core
Engine Core.
doa.engine.graphics
Lights, sprites, graphics context...
doa.engine.input
Mouse & Keyboard Event Polling.
doa.engine.log
Logger and other output.
doa.engine.maths
Math & Algebra related small toolkit.
doa.engine.net
Networking API.
doa.engine.scene
Scene, scene object, component.
doa.engine.scene.elements
Pre-made components that don't fall into the categories of either "Renderer", "Script", or "Physics Component".
doa.engine.scene.elements.physics
Physics related components.
doa.engine.scene.elements.renderers
Renderers.
doa.engine.scene.elements.scripts
Ready to use(?) scripts.
doa.engine.sound
Sound & Audio playing API.
doa.engine.task
Threading & Tasking API.
doa.engine.utils
Utility toolkit.
doa.engine.utils.discordapi
Thick wrapper to discord rich presence.
doa.main
